variance_contributors.root_cause: Multiple major component failures including gearbox, generator, blade, and transformer issues that were not anticipated in the budget planning process.
Additional specialized technicians needed for major component repairs, particularly during Q2 and Q3 when multiple failures occurred.
Depletion of critical spare parts due to component failures, requiring emergency purchases at premium prices to maintain operations.

key_budget_priorities: Preventive maintenance for problematic turbines WT-05 and WT-12 to address recurring issues and prevent major failures
Implementation of required 5-year gearbox inspections and control system upgrades for all turbines
Increasing spare parts inventory to meet minimum requirements and reduce downtime during repairs
cost_saving_measures: Implement condition-based monitoring to reduce unscheduled repairs by identifying issues before failure
Schedule maintenance activities in clusters to reduce contractor mobilization costs
Develop in-house capabilities for minor repairs to reduce dependence on subcontractors
